datafield.subfield: Use: Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use

Contents include:1. fol. i-x: ten added leaves headed Axiomata, adagia, et dicteria juris;2. fol. xi recto to xii recto: alphabetical index of words with folio numbers for each entry;3. fol. xiii recto: unidentified; verso is blank;4. fol. 1r-424r: encyclopedia;5. fol. 425r-426r: addition headed Iuris pro Cont[rabasem?]
The text cites a confirmation by Benedict XIV written 23 May 1749 (fol. xiii recto), but this may have been added.

MS 3327, Container 97: Legal encyclopedia of 278 terms arranged alphabetically from Abigeus to Vox, with an entry for Querela added at the end. Binding: Full limp parchment case fully lined with paper/paper board/paper sandwich. Straight caps, cut edges, spine lining with extensions (reused material (paper manuscript)), title in ink at head of spine. Sewn on three rolled parchment sewing supports laced through outer joints. Sewn endbands (pink/white) over rolled parchment core laced through outer joints. Endleaf components: front pastedown off-white handmade laid paper, remnant (affected by repair, including insertion of new, undersized first gathering); back pastedown off-white handmade laid paper. Repairs to sewing.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
